quizzes.question: Rearrange the code to create a style rule:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The font-size Property[/h1] The font-size property sets the size of a font. One way to set the size of fonts on the web is to use [b]keywords. [/b]For example [b]xx-small[/b], [b]small[/b], [b]medium[/b], [b]large[/b], [b]larger[/b], etc. [b]The HTML:[/b] [code format="html" ]

Paragraph text set to be small

Paragraph text set to be medium

Paragraph text set to be large

Paragraph text set to be very large

[/code] [b]The CSS: [/b] [code format="css" codeId="511"]p.small { font-size: [b]small;[/b] } p.medium { font-size: [b]medium;[/b] } p.large { font-size: [b]large;[/b] } p.xlarge { font-size: [b]x-large;[/b] }[/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2590" width="100%"] [note]Keywords are useful if you do not want the user to be able to increase the size of the font because it will adversely affect your site's appearance.[/note]
